On the morning of May 15th, gravity vanished without warning. As children floated into the sky, laughter filled the air, and adults scrambled to hold onto anything they could. In a world where breakfast floated away, creative minds emerged. A boy named Leo crafted a makeshift balloon using discarded plastic bags, soaring high to rescue his cat, Whiskers, who had taken to the clouds. Meanwhile, scientists frantically worked to restore balance. As night fell, a brilliant idea struck: they would create a gravity-repelling device. With a flash of light, gravity returned, but Leo would always remember the day he danced among the stars.
